meanings.sent1: She looked outward and saw the birds flying in the sky.

meanings.definition: Directed or moving toward the outside
meanings.sent1: The outward force pushed the door open.
meanings.sent2: The car had an outward dent from the collision.
meanings.sent3: The outward flow of the river carried the leaves downstream.
meanings.sent4: His outward enthusiasm for the project was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The outward movement of the clouds signaled an approaching storm.
